titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Jane Roberts Papers
titlestmt.author: compiled by staff of Manuscripts and Archives

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Friday April 26, 2019 at 07:14

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: Jane Roberts was an author of fiction, and of non-fiction works dealing with Seth and her role as a channeler. The papers consist of correspondence, printed material, audio and videotapes, journals, poetry, and other material documenting her personal life and literary career. Many of the documents are photocopies of originals.

langmaterial.language: The papers are in English. Foreign language editions of selected published works are included.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Researchers wishing to use the fan mail in Accessions 1985-M-014, 2002-M-027, and 2003-M-029 must sign an "Access agreement for the fan mail in the Jane Roberts Papers" in order to be given access to this material.

Original audiovisual materials, as well as preservation and duplicating masters, may not be played. Researchers must consult use copies, or if none exist must pay for a use copy, which is retained by the repository. Researchers wishing to obtain an additional copy for their personal use should consult Copying Services information on the Manuscripts and Archives web site.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright has been transferred to Yale University for unpublished materials authored or otherwise produced by Tam Mossman. Copyright is retained by Mrs. Robert F. Butts for unpublished materials authored or otherwise produced by Jane Roberts and Robert F. Butts. Copyright status for other collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Jane Roberts Papers (MS 1090). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Received from Robert F. Butts, Jr., 1985-1996, 2001-2003, and 2006. Gift of Tam Mossman, 1991, 1996-1997, 2001, and 2011. Received from Richard Kendall, 1991-1992, 1995, 1997, and 1999-2001; Seth Network International, 1993-1995 and 1997-1998; Norman Friedman, 1993; Madelon Rose Logue, 1996-2017; Ron Heckens, 1999; Anita Newell and Nancy Walker, 2000; Mary Rouen/Brass Ring Bookstore, 2000-2001 and 2006; Moment Point Press, 2001; Rick Stack, 2001-2002; Jobi Harris, 2001; Barry Noonan, 2001 and 2004; Mary Dillman, 2000-2001; Sue Watkins, 2000-2001; Joyce Combs, 2002; Mike Flynn, 2002; Lucy Gillis, 2002-2003; and Sabine Lucas, 2006. Gift of Jeff King, 2011.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The original donations to this collection were arranged in February 1988 into the following groupings: Jane Roberts material (boxes 1-32), Robert Butts, Jr. material (box 33), Tam Mossman material (boxes 34-35), and publications (boxes 36-38). Within those groupings arrangement is basically by type of material. This 1988 arrangement is followed by numerous subsequent additions.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Jane Roberts was an author of fiction, and of non-fiction works dealing with Seth and her role as a channeler. The papers consist of correspondence, printed material, audio and videotapes, journals, poetry, and other material documenting her personal life and literary career. Many of the documents are photocopies of originals.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Jane Roberts was born on May 8, 1929. She grew up in Saratoga Springs, New York, where she attended Skidmore College. In addition to writing poetry, short stories, children's literature, and novels, she is the author of non-fiction works dealing with Seth and her role as a channeler. Roberts died on September 5, 1984.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copies of commercially produced audiovisual materials contained in this collection cannot be made for researcher use outside of the repository.

Permission of Mrs. Robert F. Butts is required in order to obtain copies of or publish any collection material in boxes 1-33 that was received from Robert F. Butts. This permission is not required for material in boxes 34-38.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Materials in this boxes 1-33 were received from Robert F. Butts. Materials in boxes 34-35 were the gift of Tam Mossman. Issues of publications in boxes 36-38 were received from Mary Dillman and others.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: These audiocassette tapes are possibly related to and duplicated by reel-to-reel tapes, audiocassette tapes, and compact discs of recordings of Jane Roberts' ESP class sessions in Accessions 1998-M-079, 2001-M-058, 2002-M-015, and 2004-M-087.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This accession comprises compact discs of recordings made of Jane Roberts' ESP class sessions by Don Hall. According to one of the donors, CD#1-CD#23 were made from Richard Kendall's audiocassette recordings in Accession 1998-M-079, which were made from Hall's reel-to-reel tapes. The remaining compact discs in this accession were made directly from Hall's reel-to-reel tapes, which are in Accession 2002-M-015. See also compact discs in Accession 2004-M-087, which fill in dates missing in this accession.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access

Researchers wishing to obtain an additional copy for their personal use should consult Copying Services information on the Manuscripts and Archives web site.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: These tapes may duplicate audiocassette tapes in the original accession (Boxes 7a-7q, 8a-8q, 9a-9q, 10a-10p, and 11a-11p). Tape numbers on the reel-to-reel tapes in this accession were transcribed from the original boxes. Dates of tapes included in this inventory were transcribed from the original boxes; when no date exists in the inventory, there was none on the box to transcribe. The tapes in this accession were originally recorded by Don Hall. According to a researcher, some of these reel-to-reel tapes were used by Richard Kendall to create the audiocassettes in Accession 1998-M-079. The compact discs (and use copies) in Accession 2001-M-058 possibly duplicate the contents of the reel-to-reel tapes in this accession and the Kendall audiocassettes in Accession 1998-M-079.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This accession includes photocopies of stories by Jane Roberts previously published in Black Sheep. Stories include First Communion, Nightmare, The Big Freeze, Three Times Around, A Demon at Devotions, The Red Wagon, and Impasse.
